name: Parallel_Thm17
problem: Two triangles TUW and VSW share a point W. UT and VS are on opposings sides of point W.Given ∠ T U W ≅ ∠ U T W and S V ∥ T U. Complete the proof that ∠V ≅ ∠S.

name: Parallel_Thm18
problem: In the diagram, there is a triangle XVY. Within the triangle, line WZ intersects VY at Z and intersects VX at W.Given X Y ∥ W Z and ∠Y ≅ ∠ W X Y. Complete the proof that ∠ V W Z ≅ ∠ V Z W.

name: Parallel_Thm01
problem: Line WY and SZ intersect at X, TV and SZ intersect at U. The points Z, X, U, and S are sequentially aligned.Given ∠ W X Z and ∠ S U T are supplementary. Complete the proof that W Y ∥ T V.

name: Parallel_Thm20
problem: Two triangles WXZ and VYZ share a point Z. WX and VY are on opposings sides of point Z.Given ∠ Y V Z ≅ ∠ V Y Z and W X ∥ V Y. Complete the proof that ∠W ≅ ∠X.

name: Parallel_Thm05
problem: In the diagram, lines XV and RY intersect at W. SU and RY intersect at T. The points Y, W, T, and R are sequentially aligned.Given ∠ R T S and ∠ V W Y are supplementary. Complete the proof that V X ∥ S U.

name: Parallel_Thm11
problem: There are two triangles RSU and TQU with a common vertex U. Lines RS and TQ are on opposing sides of U.Given R S ∥ Q T and ∠Q ≅ ∠ Q T U. Complete the proof that ∠S ≅ ∠ S R U.

name: Parallel_Thm10
problem: There are two triangles VZY and WXZ with a common vertex Z. Lines VY and WX are on opposing sides of Z.Given W X ∥ V Y and ∠ Y V Z ≅ ∠Y. Complete the proof that ∠ X W Z ≅ ∠ W X Z.

name: Parallel_Thm04
problem: In the diagram, lines US and RY intersect at T. XV and RY intersect at W. The points R, T, W, and Y are sequentially aligned.Given V X ∥ S U. Complete the proof that ∠ S T W ≅ ∠ T W X.

name: Parallel_Thm12
problem: In the diagram, lines PR and SZ intersect at Q. TV and SZ intersect at U, WY and SZ intersect at X. The points S, Q, U, X, and Z are sequentially aligned.Given W Y ∥ P R and T V ∥ P R. Complete the proof that W Y ∥ T V.

name: Parallel_Thm07
problem: In the diagram, lines US and RY intersect at T. XV and RY intersect at W. The points Y, W, T, and R are sequentially aligned.Given V X ∥ S U. Complete the proof that ∠ T W X ≅ ∠ S T W.

name: Parallel_Thm19
problem: In the diagram, lines WY and SZ intersect at X. TV and SZ intersect at U, PR and SZ intersect at Q. The points S, Q, U, X, and Z are sequentially aligned.Given P R ∥ T V and W Y ∥ P R. Complete the proof that ∠ S X W ≅ ∠ V U Z.

name: Parallel_Thm08
problem: In the diagram, lines WY and SZ intersect at T. TV and SZ intersect at U. The points Z, X, U, and S are sequentially aligned.Given ∠ V U X and ∠ U X Y are supplementary. Complete the proof that T V ∥ W Y.

name: Parallel_Thm06
problem: Lines US and RY intersect at T. XV and RY intersect at W. The points Y, W, T, and R are sequentially aligned.Given ∠ S T W and ∠ T W V are supplementary. Complete the proof that S U ∥ V X.

name: Parallel_Thm02
problem: Lines UW and QX intersect at V. RT and QX intersect at S. The points X, V, S, and Q are sequentially aligned.Given R T ∥ U W. Complete the proof that ∠ T S V + ∠ S V W = 180°.

name: Parallel_Thm13
problem: There is a triangle STQ. Inside the triangle, Line RU intersects SQ at R and intersects TQ at U.Given ∠ Q R U ≅ ∠ Q U R and S T ∥ R U. Complete the proof that ∠ R S T ≅ ∠T.

name: Parallel_Thm15
problem: In the diagram, lines XV and RY intersect at W. SU and RY intersect at T, GI and RY intersect at H. The points Y, W, T, H, and R are sequentially aligned.Given V X ∥ G I and G I ∥ S U. Complete the proof that ∠ X W Y + ∠ R T U = 180°.

name: Parallel_Thm03
problem: Lines UW and QX intersect at V. RT and QX intersect at S. The points X, V, S, and Q are sequentially aligned.Given ∠ T S V and ∠ S V W are supplementary. Complete the proof that U W ∥ R T.

name: Parallel_Thm09
problem: In the diagram, lines RT and QX intersect at S. UW and QX intersect at V. The points X, V, S, and Q are sequentially aligned.Given ∠ Q S R and ∠ U V X are supplementary. Complete the proof that R T ∥ U W.

name: Parallel_Thm14
problem: In the diagram, lines HJ and SZ intersect at I. WY and SZ intersect at X, TV and SZ intersect at U. The points Z, I, X, U, and S are sequentially aligned.Given H J ∥ W Y and T V ∥ H J. Complete the proof that ∠ S X Y ≅ ∠ T U Z.

name: Parallel_Thm16
problem: In the diagram, there is a triangle TVW. Within the triangle, line XU intersects TV at U and intersects TW at X.Given ∠ T U X ≅ ∠W and U X ∥ V W. Complete the proof that ∠ U V W ≅ ∠W.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm17
problem: There is a quadrilateral □PQSR with a diagonal line PR.Given P R bisects ∠ Q P S and P R bisects ∠ Q R S. Complete the proof that R S ≅ Q R.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm18
problem: In the diagram, points E, F,H, and G form a quadrilateral □EFHG with a diagonal EG.Given G H ≅ E F. G H ∥ E F. Complete the proof that ∠ G E H ≅ ∠ E G F.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm01
problem: In the diagram, points Q, R,T, and S form a quadrilateral □QRTS. Inside the quadrilateral, there is a line QS.Q R ⟂ R S , Q T ⟂ S T , and ∠ Q S R ≅ ∠ S Q T. Complete the proof that S T ≅ Q R.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm20
problem: In the diagram, points Q, R,T, and S form a quadrilateral □QRTS. It has diaginals TR and QS intersecting at point U.∠ Q T S ≅ ∠ Q R S and ∠ R S T ≅ ∠ R Q T. Complete the proof that Q T ∥ R S.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm05
problem: In the diagram, points E, F,H, and G form a quadrilateral □EFHG with a diagonal line EG.E F ≅ G H and G H ∥ E F. Complete the proof that ∠ E G F ≅ ∠ G E H.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm11
problem: In the diagram, points S, T,V, and U form a quadrilateral □STVU with a diagonal line SU.U V ≅ T U and S T ≅ S V. Complete the proof that ∠V ≅ ∠T.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm10
problem: There is a quadrilateral □TUWV with a diagonal line TV.T U ∥ V W and V W ≅ T U. Complete the proof that ∠ V T W ≅ ∠ T V U.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm04
problem: In the diagram, points G, H,J, and I form a quadrilateral □GHJI with a diagonal line GI.Given I J ≅ G H. G H ∥ I J. Complete the proof that H I ≅ G J.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm12
problem: In the diagram, points T, U,W, and V form a quadrilateral □TUWV with an inside line TV.∠ T V U ≅ ∠ V T W , T U ⟂ U V , and V W ⟂ T W. Complete the proof that T U ≅ V W.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm07
problem: In the diagram, points H, I,K, and J form a quadrilateral □HIKJ with a diagonal line HJ.Given J K ≅ H I. J K ∥ H I. Complete the proof that ∠K ≅ ∠I.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm19
problem: In the diagram, points U, V,X, and W form a quadrilateral □UVXW with two diagonals UW and VX. Y is an extended point of WX closer to X, and line UY is formed by connecting points U and Y.Given U Y ∥ V X and W X ∥ U V and X Y ∥ U V. V X ≅ U W. Complete the proof that ∠ V W X ≅ ∠ U X W.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm08
problem: There is a quadrilateral □VWYX with a diagonal line VX.X Y ⟂ V Y , V W ∥ X Y , and V W ⟂ W X. Complete the proof that V Y ≅ W X.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm06
problem: In the diagram, points F, G,I, and H form a quadrilateral □FGIH with a diagonal line FH.F G ≅ H I and H I ∥ F G. Complete the proof that G H ≅ F I.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm02
problem: In the diagram, points E, F,H, and G form a quadrilateral □EFHG. It has a diagonal line EG.G H ∥ E F and E F ≅ G H. Complete the proof that ∠F ≅ ∠H.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm13
problem: In the diagram, there is a quadrilateral □HIKJ. HJ is a diagonal line of the quadrilateral.J K ≅ H I and H K ≅ I J. Complete the proof that ∠K ≅ ∠I.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm15
problem: In the diagram, points Q, R,T, and S form a quadrilateral □QRTS with a diagonal line QS.∠ S Q T ≅ ∠ Q S R , S T ⟂ Q T , and Q R ⟂ R S. Complete the proof that R S ≅ Q T.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm03
problem: In the diagram, points W, X,Z, and Y form a quadrilateral □WXZY with a diagonal line WY.X Y ≅ W Z and Y Z ≅ W X. Complete the proof that ∠ Y W Z ≅ ∠ W Y X.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm09
problem: In the diagram, points F, G,I, and H form a quadrilateral □FGIH with a diagonal line FH.H I ∥ F G , H I ⟂ F I , and F G ⟂ G H. Complete the proof that H I ≅ F G.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm14
problem: There is a quadrilateral □GHJI with a diagonal line GI.Given G I bisects ∠ H G J and ∠H ≅ ∠J. Complete the proof that G J ≅ G H.

name: Quadrilateral_Thm16
problem: There is a quadrilateral □FGIH with a diagonal line FH.F I ≅ G H and H I ≅ F G. Complete the proof that ∠ F H I ≅ ∠ G F H.

name: Triangle_Thm17
problem: In the diagram, points U, W, and X form a triangle △UWX, and points S, T, and V form a triangle △STV.Given ∠X ≅ ∠V. W X / S V = U X / T V. Complete the proof that ∠ U W X ≅ ∠ T S V.

name: Triangle_Thm18
problem: In the diagram, points S, T, and V form a triangle △STV, and points R, U, and W form a triangle △RUW.Given ∠V ≅ ∠R and ∠S ≅ ∠W. Complete the proof that S V / R W = T V / R U.

name: Triangle_Thm01
problem: There is a triangle △HIJ with an internal line HK intersecting IJ at K.Given H J ≅ H I. K is the midpoint of I J. Complete the proof that ∠ H K J ≅ ∠ H K I.

name: Triangle_Thm20
problem: In the diagram, points P, R, and T form a triangle △PRT, and points S, U, and Q form a triangle △SUQ.Given ∠R ≅ ∠U and ∠T ≅ ∠Q. Complete the proof that R T / Q U = P T / Q S.

name: Triangle_Thm05
problem: There is a triangle △EFG with an internal line EH intersecting FG at H.Given E H bisects ∠ F E G and E G ≅ E F. Complete the proof that G H ≅ F H.

name: Triangle_Thm11
problem: In the diagram, points V, W, and X form a triangle △VWX, and points T, U, and Y form a triangle △TUY.Given ∠V ≅ ∠T and ∠W ≅ ∠Y. Complete the proof that W X / U Y = V W / T Y.

name: Triangle_Thm10
problem: In the diagram, points Q, S, and T form a triangle △QST, and points R, U, and V form a triangle △RUV.Given ∠R ≅ ∠T. R V / Q T = R U / S T. Complete the proof that ∠ R U V ≅ ∠ Q S T.

name: Triangle_Thm04
problem: There is a triangle △UVW with an internal line UX intersecting VW at X.∠V ≅ ∠W and U X ⟂ V W. Complete the proof that U W ≅ U V.

name: Triangle_Thm12
problem: In the diagram, points I, J, and K form a triangle △IJK, and points F, G, and H form a triangle △FGH.Given ∠I ≅ ∠F and ∠K ≅ ∠G. Complete the proof that I K / F G = J K / G H.

name: Triangle_Thm07
problem: There are two triangle △VXU and △TWY.Given ∠T ≅ ∠V. T Y / U V = T W / V X. Complete the proof that ∠ T W Y ≅ ∠ U X V.

name: Triangle_Thm19
problem: In the diagram, points V, W, and X form a triangle △VWX, and points S, U, and T form a triangle △SUT.Given ∠V ≅ ∠S and ∠W ≅ ∠U. Complete the proof that W X / T U = V X / S T.

name: Triangle_Thm08
problem: In the diagram, there are two triangle △UYX and △ZVW.Given ∠Z ≅ ∠U. V Z / U X = W Z / U Y. Complete the proof that ∠ V W Z ≅ ∠ U Y X.

name: Triangle_Thm06
problem: There is a triangle △GHK with an extended point I on GH closer to H. There is another line HJ with J and K on the same side of GH.G K ∥ H J. Complete the proof that ∠G + ∠K + ∠ G H K = 180° without using the Triangle Angle Sum Theorem.

name: Triangle_Thm02
problem: There is a triangle △RST with an internal line RU intersecting ST at U.U is the midpoint of S T and R U ⟂ S T. Complete the proof that ∠ T R U ≅ ∠ S R U.

name: Triangle_Thm13
problem: In the diagram, points U, W, and X form a triangle △UWX, and points T, V, and Y form a triangle △TVY.Given ∠Y ≅ ∠U and ∠T ≅ ∠W. Complete the proof that V Y / U X = T V / W X.

name: Triangle_Thm15
problem: In the diagram, points S, T, and V form a triangle △STV, and points Q, R, and U form a triangle △QRU.Given ∠S ≅ ∠U. S V / Q U = S T / R U. Complete the proof that ∠ S T V ≅ ∠ Q R U.

name: Triangle_Thm03
problem: There is a triangle △HJI with an internal line HK intersecting IJ at K.Given H K bisects ∠ I H J and H I ≅ H J. Complete the proof that ∠ H K I ≅ ∠ H K J.

name: Triangle_Thm09
problem: In the diagram, there are two triangle △ZWU and △YXV.Given ∠U ≅ ∠Y and ∠W ≅ ∠V. Complete the proof that U W / V Y = W Z / V X.

name: Triangle_Thm14
problem: In the diagram, points I, G, and H form a triangle △IGH, and points F, J, and K form a triangle △FJK.Given ∠I ≅ ∠K and ∠H ≅ ∠F. Complete the proof that G I / J K = G H / F J.

name: Triangle_Thm16
problem: In the diagram, points F, H, and K form a triangle △FHK, and points G, I, and J form a triangle △GIJ.Given ∠H ≅ ∠G. H K / G J = F H / G I. Complete the proof that ∠ H F K ≅ ∠ G I J.

name: Congruent_Thm17
problem: There are two triangles, △RUV and △SVT that share a common vertex V. RU and ST are on opposing sides of V.U V ≅ T V and S V ≅ R V. Complete the proof that R U ≅ S T.

name: Congruent_Thm18
problem: There are two overlapping triangles, △GIF and △HEI, with a common vertex I. GF and HE are on opposing sides of I.I is the midpoint of E G and E H ∥ F G. Complete the proof that H I ≅ F I.

name: Congruent_Thm01
problem: There is a quadrilateral RSUT with vertices R, S, U, and T. There is a diagonal line segment RT drawn inside the quadrilateral, connecting vertices R and T.Given T U ≅ R S. R S ∥ T U. Complete the proof that △ R T U ≅ △ T R S.

name: Congruent_Thm20
problem: There are two triangles, △FIG and △GHJ, with a common base line segment FH and a common vertex G between it. I and J are on same side of FH.G is the midpoint of F H , G J ≅ F I , and G I ≅ H J. Complete the proof that ∠J ≅ ∠I.

name: Congruent_Thm05
problem: There are two triangles △RUP and △TQP with a shared vertex at P. Lines RU and TQ intersect at S, lines TQ and RP intersect at Q, and lines RU and TP intersect at U.Given ∠R ≅ ∠T. Q T ≅ R U. Complete the proof that △ P R U ≅ △ P T Q.

name: Congruent_Thm11
problem: There is a quadrilateral □VWUT. There is a diagonal line segment from vertex V to vertex T.Given T U ≅ V W. T U ∥ V W. Complete the proof that △ T U V ≅ △ V W T.

name: Congruent_Thm10
problem: There are two overlapping triangles, △QUT and △RUS, sharing a common vertex at point U.  QT and RS are on opposite sides of U.Given R S ⟂ Q S and Q S ⟂ Q T. U is the midpoint of Q S. Complete the proof that △ R S U ≅ △ T Q U.

name: Congruent_Thm04
problem: There are two non-overlapping triangles, △UXV and △VYW, with a common vertex V. U, V and W are collinear and ordered. X and Y are on sameside of UW.Given ∠Y ≅ ∠X and U X ≅ V Y. U X ∥ V Y. Complete the proof that △ V W Y ≅ △ U V X.

name: Congruent_Thm12
problem: There are two overlapping triangles, △TQU and △USR, sharing a common vertex at point U. TQ and SR are on opposing sides of U.Given Q S ⟂ Q T and Q S ⟂ R S. U is the midpoint of Q S. Complete the proof that △ Q T U ≅ △ S R U.

name: Congruent_Thm07
problem: There is a quadrilateral □ZWYX. There is a diagonal from vertex Y to vertex W.Given W X ≅ Y Z. W X ∥ Y Z. Complete the proof that △ W Y Z ≅ △ Y W X.

name: Congruent_Thm19
problem: There is a triangle with vertices labeled R, S, and T. Inside the triangle, there is a line segment from vertex R to the base ST, dividing the base into two segments. The point where the line segment intersects the base is labeled U.U is the midpoint of S T and R S ≅ R T. Complete the proof that ∠T ≅ ∠S.

name: Congruent_Thm08
problem: There are three triangles △TSP, △PSQ, and △QSR. △TSP and △PSQ share a side PS, △PSQ and △QSR share a side SQGiven ∠ R Q S ≅ ∠ S P T and P T ≅ Q R. △ P Q S is equilateral. Complete the proof that △ P S T ≅ △ Q S R.

name: Congruent_Thm06
problem: The image shows two overlapping triangles, △TVS and △UVR with a common vertex at V. The lines TS and UR are on opposite sides of V.Given S T ⟂ R T and S T ≅ R U and R U ⟂ R T. Complete the proof that △ S T V ≅ △ U R V.

name: Congruent_Thm02
problem: There is a quadrilateral UVTW with a diagonal line VT, which divides the quadrilateral into two triangles, △UVT and △VWT.Given T U ≅ V W. T U ∥ V W. Complete the proof that △ T U V ≅ △ V W T.

name: Congruent_Thm13
problem: There are two overlapping triangles, △JGH and △KHI, with a common vertex at point H. The points I, H and G are ordered and collinear, while K and J are on the same side of IG.Given G J ≅ H K and ∠K ≅ ∠J. G J ∥ H K. Complete the proof that △ H I K ≅ △ G H J.

name: Congruent_Thm15
problem: There is a quadrilateral □VSUT with a diagonal line SU.U V ⟂ S V , ∠ U S V ≅ ∠ S U T , and S T ⟂ T U. Complete the proof that U V ≅ S T.

name: Congruent_Thm03
problem: There are two overlapping triangles, △SRT and △TPS. They share a same side TS, and TR intersect SP at QGiven ∠P ≅ ∠R. S T ⟂ R S and S T ⟂ P T. Complete the proof that △ R S T ≅ △ P T S.

name: Congruent_Thm09
problem: There are two overlapping triangles, △VWY and △UXY, sharing a common vertex Y. The triangles are positioned such that lines VW and UX are on opposite sides of Y.Given ∠W ≅ ∠U. Y is the midpoint of U W. Complete the proof that △ V W Y ≅ △ X U Y.

name: Congruent_Thm14
problem: There are two overlapping triangles, △UYX and △VYW, with a common vertex Y. VW and UX are on opposing sides of Y.Given Y is the midpoint of U W and U X ≅ V W. Y is the midpoint of V X. Complete the proof that ∠W ≅ ∠U.

name: Congruent_Thm16
problem: There is a quadrilateral □PQSR with vertices P, Q, S, and R and diagonal QS. T is outside of the quadrilateral. PT and ST is formed by connecting T with P and S.Given S T ≅ R S and Q R ⟂ R S and ∠ Q S R ≅ ∠ P S T and P T ⟂ S T. Complete the proof that P T ≅ Q R.

name: Similarity_Thm17
problem: There is a triangle △GJI with an internal line JH intersecting GI at H.Given G J ⟂ I J and H J ⟂ G I. Complete the proof that △ H I J ~ △ H J G.

name: Similarity_Thm18
problem: There is a triangle △VWU with an internal line WT intersecting UV at T.Given V W ⟂ U W and T W ⟂ U V. Complete the proof that △ T U W ~ △ T W V.

name: Similarity_Thm01
problem: Two triangles △HGI and △EGF share a common point G. Points H and I are on one side of G, and points E and F are on another side of G.Given ∠I ≅ ∠F. Complete the proof that △ G H I ~ △ G E F.

name: Similarity_Thm20
problem: There is a triangle △FHI with an internal line GI intersecting FH at G.Given G I ⟂ F H and H I ⟂ F I. Complete the proof that △ F H I ~ △ I H G.

name: Similarity_Thm05
problem: Two triangles △GHJ and △FIJ share a common point J. Points G and H are on one side of J, and points F and I are on another side of J.Given F I ∥ G H. Complete the proof that △ F I J ~ △ H G J.

name: Similarity_Thm11
problem: In the diagram, △XUV and △UYW share a point U such that XY and WY are on opposing sides of U.U V / U W = U X / U Y. Complete the proof that △ U V X ~ △ U W Y.

name: Similarity_Thm10
problem: In the diagram, points P, R, and T form a triangle △PRT, and points Q, S, and R form a triangle △QSR. PT and QS intersect at R. QS and TP are on opposing sides of R.Given ∠P ≅ ∠S. Complete the proof that △ P R T ~ △ S R Q.

name: Similarity_Thm04
problem: Two triangles △HIG and △EIF share a common point I. Points H and G are on one side of I, and points E and F are on another side of I.Given ∠G ≅ ∠E. Complete the proof that △ G H I ~ △ E F I.

name: Similarity_Thm12
problem: There are two triangles △TSW and △UVW. Line UV is inside △TSW, and intersecting SW at U and intersecting TW at V.Given ∠T and ∠ T V U are supplementary. Complete the proof that △ U V W ~ △ S T W.

name: Similarity_Thm07
problem: Two triangles △EFG and △HIG share a common point G. Points E and F are on one side of G, and points H and I are on another side of G.F G / G H = E G / G I. Complete the proof that △ E F G ~ △ I H G.

name: Similarity_Thm19
problem: There is a triangle △HIJ with an internal line IK intersecting HJ at K.Given I K ⟂ H J and H I ⟂ I J. Complete the proof that △ I J K ~ △ H I K.

name: Similarity_Thm08
problem: Two triangles △GHI and △GJK share a common point G. KJ is inside △GHI intersecting GI at K and GH at J.G J / G H = G K / G I. Complete the proof that △ G J K ~ △ G H I.

name: Similarity_Thm06
problem: Two triangles △UVY and △UWX share a common point U. XW and VY are on opposing sides of U.Given W X ∥ V Y. Complete the proof that △ U W X ~ △ U V Y.

name: Similarity_Thm02
problem: Two triangles △TRS and △VRU share a common point R. Points T and S are on one side of R, and points V and U are on another side of R.Given U V ∥ S T. Complete the proof that △ R U V ~ △ R T S.

name: Similarity_Thm13
problem: In the diagram, points T, S, Q form a triangle △TSQ, and points R, P, and T form a triangle △RPT with a common point T. RP and SQ are on oppoising sides of T.Given P R ∥ Q S. Complete the proof that △ P R T ~ △ S Q T.

name: Similarity_Thm15
problem: Two triangles △VYZ and △WXZ share a point Z. Lines VY and WX are on opposing sides of Z.Given ∠W ≅ ∠Y. Complete the proof that △ W X Z ~ △ Y V Z.

name: Similarity_Thm03
problem: Points V, W and Z form a triangle △VWZ. The line XY is inside the triangle and intersects VZ and WZ at Y and X, respectively.Given X Y ∥ V W. Complete the proof that △ X Y Z ~ △ W V Z.

name: Similarity_Thm09
problem: Two triangles △PRT and △QST share a common point T. Points P and R are on one side of T, and points Q and S are on another side of T.Given Q S ∥ P R. Complete the proof that △ Q S T ~ △ R P T.

name: Similarity_Thm14
problem: Two triangles △XWY and △VWZ share a point W. Lines XY and VZ are on opposing sides of W.W Z / W X = V W / W Y. Complete the proof that △ V W Z ~ △ Y W X.

name: Similarity_Thm16
problem: Two triangles △RUT and △SUQ share a point U. RT is inside triangle △QSU intersecting SU at R and QU at T.R U / S U = T U / Q U. Complete the proof that △ R T U ~ △ S Q U.
